bonds.description: I face danger and evil to offset an unredeemable act in my past.
I must set an example of hope for those who have given up.
I’m searching for a fellow marine captured by an elusive enemy.
Fear leads to tyranny, and both must be eradicated.
My commander betrayed my unit, and I will have revenge.

definition.description:
You were trained for battle on sandy beaches and rocky shores. You have launched midnight raids from swift ships whose names evoke terror in the hearts of your adversaries. The water is your second home, the rain your shelter, and the crashing waves your battle cry.

 
Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Survival
Tool Proficiencies: Vehicles (water, land)
Equipment: A dagger that belonged to a fallen comrade, a folded flag emblazoned with the symbol of your ship or company, a set of traveler’s clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

FEATURE: STEADY

You can move twice the normal amount of time (up to 16 hours) each day before being subject to the effect of a forced march (see “Travel Pace” in chapter 8 of the Player’s Handbook). Additionally, you can automatically find a safe route to land a boat on shore, provided such a route exists.

HARDSHIP ENDURED

Hardship in your past has forged you into an unstoppable living weapon. This hardship is essential to you and is at the heart of a personal philosophy or ethos that often guides your actions. You can roll on the following table to determine this hardship or choose one that best fits your character.

D6 HARDSHIP
1 Nearly Drowned. You hid underwater to avoid detection by enemies and held your breath for an extremely long time. Just before you would have died, you had a revelation about your existence.
2 Captured. You spent months enduring thirst, starvation, and torture at the hands of your enemy, but you never broke.
3 Sacrifice. You enabled the escape of your fellow soldiers, but at great cost to yourself. Some of your past comrades may think you’re dead.
4 Juggernaut. No reasonable explanation can explain how you survived a particular battle. Every arrow and bolt missed you. You slew scores of enemies single-handedly and led your comrades to victory.
5 Stowaway. For days, you hid in the bilge of an enemy ship, surviving on brackish water and foolhardy rats. At the right moment, you crept up to the deck and took over the ship on your own.
6 Leave None Behind. You carried an injured marine for miles to avoid capture and death.
 
Suggested Characteristics

Marines are looked up to by other soldiers and respected by their superiors. They are veteran warriors who rarely lose composure on the battlefield. Marines who leave the service tend to work as mercenaries, but their combat experience also makes them excellent adventurers. Though they are self-reliant, marines tend to operate best in groups, valuing camaraderie and the companionship of like-minded individuals.

D8 PERSONALITY TRAIT
1 I speak rarely but mean every word I say.
2 I laugh loudly and see the humor in stressful situations.
3 I prefer to solve problems without violence, but I finish fights decisively.
4 I enjoy being out in nature; poor weather never sours my mood.
5 I am dependable.
6 I am always working on some project or other.
7 I become cantankerous and quiet in the rain.
8 When the sea is within my sight, my mood is jovial and optimistic.
D6 IDEAL
1 Teamwork. Success depends on cooperation and communication. (Good)
2 Code. The marines’ code provides a solution for every problem, and following it is imperative. (Lawful)
3 Embracing. Life is messy. Throwing yourself into the worst of it is necessary to get the job done. (Chaotic)
4 Might. The strong train so that they might rule those who are weak. (Evil)
5 Bravery. To act when others quake in fear — this is the essence of the warrior. (Any)
6 Perseverance. No injury or obstacle can turn me from my goal. (Any)
D6 BOND
1 I face danger and evil to offset an unredeemable act in my past.
2 I. Will. Finish. The. Job.
3 I must set an example of hope for those who have given up.
4 I’m searching for a fellow marine captured by an elusive enemy.
5 Fear leads to tyranny, and both must be eradicated.
6 My commander betrayed my unit, and I will have revenge.
D6 FLAW
1 I grow combative and unpredictable when I drink.
2 I find civilian life difficult and struggle to say the right thing in social situations.
3 My intensity can drive others away.
4 I hold grudges and have difficulty forgiving others.
5 I become irrational when innocent people are hurt.
6 I sometimes stay up all night listening to the ghosts of my fallen enemies.

Saltmarsh Ties

As a former member of Saltmarsh’s elite marine contingent, you are friends of Tom and Will Stoutly and can turn to them for help and support. Eliander Fireborn, captain of the guard, also makes time to listen to your concerns.
definition.equipmentDescription: A dagger that belonged to a fallen comrade, a folded flag emblazoned with the symbol of your ship or company, a [item]Clothes, Traveler's;set of traveler’s clothes[/item], and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

Additionally, you can automatically find a safe route to land a boat on shore, provided such a route exists.

definition.name: Marine

personalityTraits.description: I speak rarely but mean every word I say.
I laugh loudly and see the humor in stressful situations.
I prefer to solve problems without violence, but I finish fights decisively.
I enjoy being out in nature; poor weather never sours my mood.
I am always working on some project or other.
I become cantankerous and quiet in the rain.
When the sea is within my sight, my mood is jovial and optimistic.

definition.shortDescription: You were trained for battle on sandy beaches and rocky shores. You have launched midnight raids from swift ships whose names evoke terror in the hearts of your adversaries. The water is your second home, the rain your shelter, and the crashing waves your battle cry.
definition.suggestedCharacteristicsDescription: Marines are looked up to by other soldiers and respected by their superiors. They are veteran warriors who rarely lose composure on the battlefield. Marines who leave the service tend to work as mercenaries, but their combat experience also makes them excellent adventurers. Though they are self-reliant, marines tend to operate best in groups, valuing camaraderie and the companionship of like-minded individuals.

race.description:
Shifters - sometimes called the weretouched - are humanoids with a bestial aspect.

Racial Traits
Darkvision, Shifting

Stoic and solid, a beasthide shifter draws strength and stability from the beast within. Beasthide shifters are typically tied to the bear or the boar, but this subrace could embody any creature known for its toughness.

definition.name: Age
definition.description: Shifters are quick to mature both physically and emotionally, reaching young adulthood at age 10. They rarely live to be more than 70 years old.

definition.name: Alignment
definition.description: Shifters tend toward neutrality, being more focused on survival than concepts of good and evil. A love of personal freedom can drive shifters toward chaotic alignments.

definition.name: Size
definition.description:
Your size is Medium. To set your height and weight randomly, start with rolling a size modifier:

Size modifier = 2d8

Height = 4 feet + 6 inches + your size modifier in inches

Weight in pounds = 90 + (2d4 × your size modifier)

definition.name: Speed
definition.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

definition.name: Darkvision
definition.description: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
definition.snippet: You can see in dim light within 60 ft. as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

definition.name: Shifting
definition.description:
As a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You also gain additional benefits that depend on your shifter subrace, described below.

Once you shift, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
definition.snippet: Once per short rest as a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain {{characterlevel+modifier:con@min:1}} temp HP and additional benefits that depend on your shifter subrace.

definition.name: Languages
definition.description: You can speak, read, and write Common.

definition.name: Subrace
definition.description: The beast within shapes each shifter physically and mentally. The four major subraces of shifter include: beasthide, longtooth, swiftstride, and wildhunt. Choose a subrace for your shifter.

definition.name: Ability Score Increase
definition.description: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

definition.name: Natural Athlete
definition.description: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.
definition.snippet: You have proficiency with the Athletics skill.

definition.name: Shifting Feature
definition.description: Whenever you shift, you gain 1d6 additional temporary hit points. While shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.
definition.snippet: Whenever you shift, you gain 1d6 additional temporary hit points. While shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

notes.backstory:
Ceniza es uno de los cuatro hijos de Sauce y Norte, dos cambiaformas que habitaban el bosque de Gar, sus padres lo llamaron así por su aspecto, desde entonces ha portado su nombre con orgullo. Nunca ha destacado por algo en especial, pero mostró interés por todas las enseñanzas que sus padres trataron de transmitirle a él y sus hermanos. Fue así como aprendió a servirse de las habilidades de su gente, a controlar sus instintos y convivir con la naturaleza, manteniendo un fino equilibrio entre la bestia interior y la razón.

A pesar de que siempre estuvo arropado por todos, era algo distante, en ocasiones el joven salía al bosque a merodear, descansando contemplativo sobre la rama de algún árbol durante largas horas. En uno de esos pasatiempos, conoció a Hiedra, una joven de una aldea vecina del mismo bosque. Desde entonces han sido inseparables.

Hace poco más de siete años, los dos decidieron abandonar el bosque como muchos otros antes que ellos, para formar una familia en algún lugar donde pudieran asentarse. Durante el tiempo que estuvieron buscando ese sitio, tanto él como ella se unieron a La Estrella Plateada (una compañía mercantil de Nyanzaru) como protección. Este periodo duró algo más de cinco años, durante el cual sirvieron en diferentes naves, siempre en algún mar y en ocasiones separados durante meses.

Ambos libres de su contrato cinco años más tarde y con un hogar al fin en su nombre, casi podían disfrutar de su tiempo juntos. No obstante las cosas no siempre son tan fáciles, y pronto la pareja descubrió que los continuos impuestos y problemas burocráticos de los cuales eran ignorantes les supondría un quebradero de cabeza.

Por si fuera poco, Hiedra estaba embarazada, ese fue el único motivo para que Ceniza saliera a buscar un trabajo mejor pagado, algo que pueda permitirles vivir cómodamente mucho tiempo, a salvo. Tranquilos.
notes.organizations: Gran Compañía de la Estrella Plateada de Nyanzaru
notes.otherNotes:
• Pareja: Hiedra
• Padres: Sauce (f.) y Norte (m.)
• Hermanos: Horizonte (f.), Remolino (m.)  y Atardecer (f.)
• Penurias (Juggernaut): ninguna explicación razonable puede explicar cómo sobreviviste a una batalla en particular. Cada flecha y virote te erró. Mataste a montones de enemigos sin ayuda y llevaste a tus camaradas a la victoria.

traits.appearance:
Ceniza ya destaca por su piel pálida y grisácea o su cabello oscuro, el cual lleva recogido hacia atrás en una trenza desigual, cubierta en cenizas. Sin embargo todo ello palidece al ver sus ojos felinos, amarillentos, las negras garras que terminan sus dedos donde tuvieran que haber uñas o su achatado hocico. 

Una túnica azul, entrecruzada, deshilada y desgastada por el tiempo, sobre la cual se pueden ver estampados diminutos rombos blancos es una de las únicas prendas decoradas que viste, por encima de una cota de mallas en similar estado, la cual no llega a sus codos. Dos cinturones sujetan ambas prendas, uno de ellos sirve a la vaina de una espada. 
Su pantalón es holgado por encima de sus rodillas pero se encuentra completamente atado por debajo de ellas, mediante unas cintas en otro momento blancas, raídas. Por encima de ellas lleva unas grebas gemelas, de algún tipo de acero arañado y con numerosos golpes. Sus pies terminan en garras también, son visibles pues va prácticamente descalzo, viste algún tipo de calzado exótico que curiosamente solo cubre su planta y empeine.

Sobre los hombros, una capa azul marino, prácticamente rozando el negro, castigada, que se sujeta con un broche plateado y la cual no llega al suelo. A pesar de su aspecto, su confección parece fina y de calidad.

En su espalda un redondo y azulado escudo repleto de golpes y muescas, tiene una estrella de 16 puntas pintada sobre él. La lanza que lleva en su mano está machacada por igual.
traits.flaws: A veces me quedo despierto toda la noche escuchando a los fantasmas de mis enemigos caídos.
traits.ideals: Perseverancia. Ninguna lesión u obstáculo puede apartarme de mi objetivo. (Todos)
traits.personalityTraits:
Hablo raramente pero las palabras que digo tienen todo su significado.
Cuando el mar está a la vista, mi estado de ánimo es jovial y optimista.

definition.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.
definition.name: Shield

definition.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.
definition.name: Chain Mail

definition.description: Proficiency with a spear allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.
definition.name: Spear

properties.description: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.
properties.name: Thrown

properties.description: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property--the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.
properties.name: Versatile

definition.description: Proficiency with a scimitar allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.
definition.name: Scimitar

properties.description: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
properties.name: Finesse

properties.description: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.
properties.name: Light

definition.description:
A backpack is a leather pack carried on the back, typically with straps to secure it. A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear.

You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.
definition.name: Backpack

definition.description: You never know where you’re going to sleep, and a bedroll helps you get better sleep in a hayloft or on the cold ground. A bedroll consists of bedding and a blanket thin enough to be rolled up and tied. In an emergency, it can double as a stretcher.
definition.name: Bedroll

definition.description: This set of clothes could consist of boots, a wool skirt or breeches, a sturdy belt, a shirt (perhaps with a vest or jacket), and an ample cloak with a hood.
definition.name: Clothes, Traveler's

definition.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.
definition.name: Mess Kit

definition.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.
definition.name: Rations (1 day)

definition.description: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.
definition.name: Rope, Hempen (50 feet)

definition.description: A standard shovel used for digging.
definition.name: Shovel

definition.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch -- or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel -- takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.
definition.name: Tinderbox

definition.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.
definition.name: Torch

definition.description: A waterskin can hold 4 pints of liquid.
definition.name: Waterskin

definition.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
definition.name: Fighting Style
definition.snippet: You adopt a fighting style specialty.

definition.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.
definition.name: Second Wind
definition.snippet: Once per short rest, you can use a bonus action to regain 1d10 + {{classlevel}} HP.

definition.description:
Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.
definition.name: Action Surge
definition.snippet: You can take one additional action on your turn. This can be used {{scalevalue}} times per short rest.

definition.description: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques. Choose Champion, Battle Master, or Eldritch Knight, all detailed at the end of the class description. The archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.
definition.name: Martial Archetype

definition.description:
When you reach 4th level, and again at 6th, 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.
definition.name: Ability Score Improvement

definition.description:
Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level in this class and to four when you reach 20th level in this class.
definition.multiClassDescription:
This feature could be affected by multiclassing. See the Multiclassing rules for more information.

Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level in this class and to four when you reach 20th level in this class.
definition.name: Extra Attack
definition.snippet: You can attack twice whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

definition.description:
Beginning at 9th level, you can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

You can use this feature twice between long rests starting at 13th level and three times between long rests starting at 17th level.
definition.name: Indomitable
definition.snippet: You can reroll a saving throw that you fail - you must use the new roll. You can use this {{scalevalue}} times per long rest.

definition.description:
When you reach 6th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.
definition.name: Ability Score Improvement

definition.description:
When you reach 8th level, and again at 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.
definition.name: Ability Score Improvement

definition.description:
When you reach 12th level, and again at 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.
definition.name: Ability Score Improvement

definition.description:
When you reach 14th level, and again at 16th and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.
definition.name: Ability Score Improvement

definition.description:
When you reach 16th level, and again at 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.
definition.name: Ability Score Improvement

definition.description:
When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.
definition.name: Ability Score Improvement

definition.description:
Beginning at 11th level, you can attack three times, instead of twice, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

The number of attacks increases to four when you reach 20th level in this class.
definition.multiClassDescription: This feature could be affected by multiclassing. See the Multiclassing rules for more information.
definition.name: Extra Attack
definition.snippet: You can attack three times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

definition.description: At 20th level, you can attack four times, instead of three, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
definition.multiClassDescription: This feature could be affected by multiclassing. See the Multiclassing rules for more information.
definition.name: Extra Attack
definition.snippet: You can attack four times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

definition.description:
Armor: All armor, shields
Weapons: Simple weapons, martial weapons
Tools: None
Saving Throws: Strength, Constitution
Skills: Choose two skills from Acrobatics, Animal Handling, Athletics, History, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, and Survival
definition.multiClassDescription:
Armor: Light armor, medium armor, shields
Weapons: Simple weapons, martial weapons
definition.name: Proficiencies

definition.description:
Hit Dice: 1d10 per fighter level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per fighter level after 1st
definition.name: Hit Points

classFeatures.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
classFeatures.name: Fighting Style

classFeatures.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

classFeatures.description:
Beginning at 11th level, you can attack three times, instead of twice, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

The number of attacks increases to four when you reach 20th level in this class.
classFeatures.name: Extra Attack

classFeatures.description: At 20th level, you can attack four times, instead of three, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
classFeatures.name: Extra Attack

classFeatures.description:
Armor: All armor, shields
Weapons: Simple weapons, martial weapons
Tools: None
Saving Throws: Strength, Constitution
Skills: Choose two skills from Acrobatics, Animal Handling, Athletics, History, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, and Survival
classFeatures.name: Proficiencies

classFeatures.description:
Hit Dice: 1d10 per fighter level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per fighter level after 1st
classFeatures.name: Hit Points

definition.description:
A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor

Hit Die: d10
Primary Ability: Strength or Dexterity
Saves: Strength & Constitution
definition.equipmentDescription:
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • (a) chain mail or (b) leather armor, longbow, and 20 arrows
  • (a) a martial weapon and a shield or (b) two martial weapons
  • (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) two handaxes
  • (a) a dungeoneer’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack
definition.name: Fighter

definition.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
definition.name: Dueling
definition.snippet: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

options.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
options.label: Archery

options.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
options.label: Defense

options.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
options.label: Dueling

options.description: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.
options.label: Great Weapon Fighting

options.description: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.
options.label: Protection

options.description: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
options.label: Two-Weapon Fighting

class.name: Action Surge
class.snippet: You can take one additional action on your turn. This can be used {{scalevalue}} times per short rest.

class.name: Second Wind
class.snippet: Once per short rest, you can use a bonus action to regain 1d10 + {{classlevel}} HP.

race.description:
As a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You also gain additional benefits that depend on your shifter subrace, described below.

Once you shift, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
race.name: Shifting
race.snippet: Once per short rest as a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain {{characterlevel+modifier:con@min:1}} temp HP and additional benefits that depend on your shifter subrace.
